titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale University Library Records Concerning Position Classification and Pay Plans
Yale University Library Records Concerning Position Classification and Pay Plans
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:15

did.unittitle: Yale University Library records concerning position classification and pay plans

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: T he records consist of reports, charts, statistical data, questionnaires, job descriptions, and work description sheets documenting position classifications, pay plans, and the trainee program at the Yale University Library.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 32-A (YRG 32-A), Central records of the Yale University Library and records of the librarian

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See inventory for details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale University Library Records Concerning Position Classification and Pay Plans (RU 806). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: T he records consist of reports, charts, statistical data, questionnaires, job descriptions, and work description sheets documenting position classifications, pay plans, and the trainee program at the Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Records of the Yale University Librarian concerning position classification and pay plans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The material in this series is alphabetically arranged by subject. Within the large sections on other libraries' systems and work description sheets, the material is in alphabetical order by name of library or department.

Included in this series are reports, forms, charts, statistical records, questionnaires, and miscellaneous types of material. Topics cover the American Library Association, class specification, job and merit analysis and rating, position classification, the trainee program, and work description sheets. At the end there is an Historical copy of Library Job Descriptions, in 2 vols.
